issues.description: The constructor parameter order in template Meal.java does not match the problem specification or the solution. The UML and solution expect Meal(String name, String[] ingredients), but the template defines Meal(String[] ingredients, String name). This prevents students from following the specified constructor signature and causes compilation errors with the provided Main code.
issues.suggested_fix: In template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Meal.java, change the constructor signature to `public Meal(String name, String[] ingredients)` (matching UML and solution) and swap the parameter order accordingly.

issues.description: The Meal constructor signature is inconsistent: the problem statement and reference solution specify Meal(String name, String[] ingredients), but the template defines Meal(String[] ingredients, String name). This reversal of parameter order and names conflicts with the class diagram and example usage in Main, causing compilation errors and confusion for students.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename and reorder the Meal constructor parameters in the template to match the specification: public Meal(String name, String[] ingredients).
